txt.en:
'Hallo, friend! As many folk in these parts know, Old Mad Baggins was a great lover of riddles, so it seems he left a riddle or two for us in his Haunted Burrow.

'Only problem is, I can't make a thing of it! After the first riddle, I must have had a drink from the wrong bottle, and it made me worse off than before.

'I believe he meant for us to have a great treasure if we managed to solve it all, but who has the patience for such tomfoolery? If you can figure it out and tell me how it goes, I'll be sure to give you all the coins I've managed to get my hands on so far.'

<rgb=#FF0000>NOTE: Only one Haunted Burrow quest may be underway at a time.</rgb>

Three bottles sit before you,
Yet their colours mustn't bore you,
For if first you drink
And last you think,
You'll find that I out-score you.

The Correct Bottle:
He weeps golden tears in morn's light,
A mighty shield he makes at Sun's height,
In evening, rain tumbles and cascades,
At night, sleeps bare in the bed he's made.

The Orange Bottle has an etching of a Warrior.
The White Bottle has an etching of a Tree.
The Blue Bottle has an etching of a Cloud.

Three bottles sit before you,
Yet their colours mustn't bore you,
For if first you drink
And last you think,
You'll find that I out-score you.

The Correct Bottle:
The only certainty is death in battle,
For once thrust, my sword is lost.
Henceforth, sweet life must be lived to its fullest.

The Orange Bottle has an etching of a thief.
The White Bottle has an etching of gold coins.
The Blue Bottle has an etching of a bee.

Three bottles sit before you,
Yet their colours mustn't bore you,
For if first you drink
And last you think,
You'll find that I out-score you.

The Correct Bottle:
Upon him thy thoughts laid,
take care;
He whispers sharp as a knife-blade.
Beneath thy feather staid,
beware;
In billows is thy trust betrayed.

The Orange Bottle has an etching of paper.
The White Bottle has an etching of an eagle.
The Blue Bottle has an etching of a hat.

Three bottles sit before you,
Yet their colours mustn't bore you,
For if first you drink
And last you think,
You'll find that I out-score you.

When we were introduced, I did not agree with you one bit.
But I helped you on our second meeting, did I not?
When we met last, I didn't seem to affect you one way or another.
Which bottle am I?
You feel invigourated from your drink
'Did you really make it all the way through based on solving the riddles? Well done, [placeholder]! You are far cleverer than I; that much is certain.'
That was only water
The blue bottle contained a unwholesome liquid
You made it to the Cobwebbed Wing Entrance
That tasted like water
Yech! That didn't taste quite right....
That was delicious, whatever it was!

Adalgrim Goodbody found himself confounded by Bilbo's riddles found throughout the Haunted Burrow.\n\n<rgb=#FF0000> NOTE: This quest will be removed from your quest log when the event it is associated with ends. </rgb>
You made it to the Creeping Wing's entrance
That wasn't good, whatever it was
Talk to Adalgrim Goodbody outisde the Haunted Burrow
Follow the riddles through the burrow before the time runs out
Use the hint inside the Haunted Burrow to determine which bottle to drink from (this will help you navigate the course)
Get to the door of the Cobwebbed Wing
Use the clue to determine which bottle to choose
Go to the entrance to the Creeping Wing
Determine which bottle you should choose
Find the door to the Basement
Read the clue to determine which bottle to use
Find the door out of the basement
Return to the main entrance of the Haunted Burrow
The bottles can be found at the entrance to the Haunted Burrow.\n\nYou should use the correct bottle to navigate to the entrance to the Creeping Wing -- but be wary of which bottle you drink from!
That was a wonderful drink
The entrance to the Cobwebbed Wing is at the other end of the Main Cellar.\n\nYou must make it to the entrance to the Cobwebbed Wing before the time runs out.
That didn't taste like much of anything
The potion bottles that will enable you to move through the Cobwebbed Wing are at the entrance to the wing.\n\nYou should examine the clue and select the correct bottle.
You made it to the entrance to the Basement

The door to the Creeping Wing is somewhere in the Cobwebbed Wing.

You should get to the door of the Creeping Wing
before the time expires.
That was definitely not a good bottle to drink from

The bottles can be found at the entrance to the Creeping Wing in the Haunted Burrow.\n\nYou should use the correct bottle to navigate to the exit of the Creeping Wing -- but be wary of which bottle you drink from!
That was invigourating!
The door to the basement is the exit to the Creeping Wing.\n\nYou should seek the exit to the Creeping Wing before the time runs out.
That tasted suspiciously like water

The bottles can be found at the entrance to the Basement in the Haunted Burrow.\n\nYou should use the correct bottle to navigate to the exit of the Basement -- but be wary of which bottle you drink from!
Now you must leave the basement and head back to the Party Tree!
The door to the Main Cellar is at the other end of the basement.\n\nYou should return to the Main Cellar as quickly as you can.
You're almost there! Get to Adalgrim Goodbody before the time runs out
The exit to the Party Tree is the door that let you into the Haunted Burrow.\n\nYou should find your way back to the Main Entrance.
You have run out of time
You have left the Haunted Burrow
'You'll have quite the conundrum waiting for you inside, [placeholder]! Good luck....'
Adalgrim Goodbody stands outside the Haunted Burrow, near the Party Tree.\n\nYou should return to Adalgrim Goodbody with news of your success at the riddle-game.
A Riddle in a Bottle
